replies.body: gotta love how a good and honest thread like this one is getting ignored because its not circlejerking on ad champs and zed rofl

If I had to guess, it goes ignored because it doesn't open up proper discussion. At all. It literally states what it wants to state as a fact and leaves itself closed. It won't pick up any steam or go heeded unless you go out of your way and force that on it, and even then it's an uphill battle. 

The topic creator won't change his mind, because it's very clear that he very firmly believes what he's saying. Also, if you were to try to debate against it, I'm almost certain he'd shut down any attempts to. 

I've seen this type of topic and its wording before, and it goes ignored for a reason.
rofl i can just make a zed thread tomorrow and ill get shit tons of upvoted because circlejerk

With this exact same wording.. go for it. I guess. I don't really care, just pointing out why these threads usually go ignored. Even Zed QQ threads tend to have a bit more substance. Not always, but still. 

I prefer lore/story boards anyway, so say whatever you want about balance, I guess. People tend to be more rational over there.
Just because she is good against assassins does not mean she is broken.
annie main?

I love when people complain about champions like this. It makes my day. 

I don't even mean just Annie -- she can be straight up bullshit. But complaining like this is actually really, really funny to me for some reason. 

Annie goes mostly untalked about all the way up until she becomes big as a support some seasons ago, and suddenly she's considered broken in both lanes she goes to. 

She's not even broken. Have people really forgotten what the term means?

I'm assuming you don't know what the term "broken" means in this context.

Broken: something that stomped me in game so I came to threads to complain about :(
Ah, I forgot about its new definition. Thank you for clarifying :)
she actually is broken, because of her passive. if they dont fix her passive, then they need to lower her damage, a lot.

Targetted CC, a bit of durability, high damage, mediocre range, no mobility to speak of, and completely burst-based. 

You're right - this is a DotA hero, the fuck is she doing in League? Or can we not do simple but effective designs here? Sorry, I'm just unclear.

Broken: not working as intended. 

Annie is working as intended.
you're wrong bro. kalista is broken, but she's working as intended. I'm pretty sure Riot knew what they were doing with Poppy, and she is working as intended.

No, kalista is overpowered, she is too strong.

Broken is when anivia had a global stun, because she was too strong due to an unintended interaction.

Kalista is too strong, because of intended interactions, because her numbers are too high.

Broken = unintended interactions.
Overpowered = intended interactions, but too strong.

Solo lane Annie is pure cancer and does not have a healthy play pattern at all. She invalidates any duels against other squishies by stunning them and one shotting them and gets free defensive stats from her E so in case you somehow survived her nuking combo she is gonna be tankier than you in majority of cases and get you in the next round of spells anyway. She definitely needs a rework at this point.

Imho Annie is a last champ that is truly newbie player friendly. If Riot will veigar her too, I think this will be end of LoL, because any game ends when freshblood is stopping to come. With every patch their number becoming lower, and right now half of them is unplayable, because champions without skillshots can't damage, because it's OP.

The problem with Annie is the lane control she gets when her stun is up.  It is like TF with gold card before his timer was reduced.  What Annie does is get her stun up and then zone you from the minion wave, even if you have decent range.  This is because she will win any trade by a decent margin whIle her stun is up.
